issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contains sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for Android

### AdGuard version

3.6.9

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Website or app doesn't work properly

### Which browser(s) do you use?

other(specify in comment below)

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

thegioididong.com

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

Protect from DPI

### Add your comment and screenshots

I find that thegioididong.com is already in the list:

https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/425669ced45729794a5d75e2554b959fb0a7bf2e/EnglishFilter/sections/allowlist_stealth.txt#L26

but it's not in: https://filters.adtidy.org/android/filters/2_optimized.txt

comment.body:
No, it's not a typo.
Here - `https://param.com.tr/en/` is used `param.com.tr/en/dist/js/gdpr-cookie.js`, so a rule like this:
```
||param.com.tr/dist/js/gdpr-cookie.js
```
will be not block it.

Alternatively something like this:
```
/dist/js/gdpr-cookie.js$domain=param.com.tr
```
also would be okay, but I think that it's not necessary to change current rule.
